title: The Bellair
source: Turkey and the Wolf - Mason Hereford & JJ Goode
categories: Turkey and the Wolf - Mason Hereford & JJ Goode
ingredients: Four 8-inch French or hoagie rolls, split
½cup Ocean Spray Jellied Cranberry Sauce
Heaping ½ cup Bellair-Style Herb Mayo (this page)
1pound sliced (ideally ⅛ inch thick) smoky ham
8ounces super-sharp cheddar, sliced ⅛ inch thick
directions: Move an oven rack 8 inches or so from your broiler and preheat the broiler. Toast the rolls, cut-sides up, under the broiler for a minute or so, just until they’re golden brown and crackly but still soft inside.
Give the cranberry sauce a good stir so it’s spreadable, then spread it on the top halves of each roll. Spread the herb mayo on the bottom halves.

For each sandwich, put a fourth of the ham on the roll bottoms (feel free to artistically fold each slice like they do at Subway). Pile on about 1 cup of the arugula (it’s a lot, so just try your best to tuck it in there). Then puzzle-piece on a fourth of the cheese in an even layer with minimal overhang. Throw the tops on those bad boys and eat.
